productsHero.description: The right PPE is a critical line of defence that protects workers from hazards, prevents injuries, and saves lives. Research shows that effective PPE usage can reduce workplace injury rates by up to 60%, underscoring how crucial the right equipment is to a safer, more productive work environment. Poorly fitted or inadequate PPE, on the other hand, is demonstrated to be a concurring factor to the majority of registered injuries.

1980.title: First Innovation
1980.description: We develop the first wool mitten for high-temperature mould handling in the hot end of the glass manufacturing process

1996.title: Standards Certification
1996.description: We led the way in adapting to newly introduced EN388 and EN407 standards bringing certified products to all our customers. Our products are widely adopted across major glass manufacturing and automotive plants in Italy

2002.title: Portfolio Expansion
2002.description: We enlarge our product portfolio dedicated to the glass and metallurgy industries with many gloves certified over 1000°C. Our geographical expansion starts across 6 markets in Europe and Middle East, driven by our existing Italian customers.

2003.title: Company Incorporation
2003.description: Hand Line Company is incorporated, marking the shift from artisanal firm into business enterprise that has flourished, has won credibility, and inspired confidence to a wider number of clients. We supply gloves and other PPE across 10 markets in Europe and the East

2005.title: Extreme Heat Innovation
2005.description: We develop and certify a unique glove able to withstand over 1,000°C contact heat for extreme conditions: HL 1000

2015.title: Digital Transformation
2015.description: Hand Line embarks in its digitalisation of processes and marks the change with a brand re-design

2023.title: Infrastructure Expansion
2023.description: We invest in a significant expansion of our HQ and Warehouse in northern Italy, driven by increased portfolio of customers and international footprint

2025.title: UK Market Entry

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Find quick answers to common questions about our safety gloves and services

questions.question: How do I choose the right PPE?
questions.answer: Selecting the right PPE is crucial to ensure the safety and wellbeing of your employees. Firstly, we recommend gathering detailed information of the working conditions and risk exposure in the most extreme conditions encountered. That will give an indication of the protection levels and practical requirements for the PPE. Our website includes a wide range of products that you can filter by requirements, environment conditions, risk category, or protection level. We always recommend contacting our team to discuss and recommend the most suitable PPE based on your work environment and required protection. We are just one click away.

questions.question: Are you able to customise and design bespoke PPE?
questions.answer: Yes, we can create tailored hand protection solutions based on your specific requirements. We have the capability of creating samples within weeks. Many of the products we offer today were initially created for our customers' specifications.

questions.question: Can I request product samples for testing?
questions.answer: Yes, we offer samples for industrial customers and distributors. Please contact us with your company details and application requirements to arrange a sample pack.

questions.question: Do you ship internationally?
questions.answer: Yes, we currently supply PPE in over 15 market across EMEA and have the capability to deliver globally.

questions.question: What industries do you serve?
questions.answer: Our products are designed for a wide range of industries including glass manufacturing, metal production, construction, automotive, food processing, logistics, and metalworking. We have developed deep industry expertise in glass and metal manufacturing and heavy industry with over 40 years of experience serving large international customers. We are both a reliable supplier and a trusted advisor to our customers.

questions.question: Do you offer OEM or private label options?
questions.answer: Yes, we can support OEM and private label manufacturing for partners looking to customise gloves, garments, etc with their own branding, packaging, or specifications. Contact us to discuss your requirements.

questions.question: What standards do your product comply with?
questions.answer: All our products are certified according to European PPE Regulation (EU) 2016/425 and comply with relevant EN standards.

questions.question: How do I become a distributor or reseller of your products?
questions.answer: Please fill out our distributor application form or contact our team directly at distribution@handlineco.com. We support resellers with marketing materials, technical training, and flexible ordering options.

hero.title: Product
hero.description: Hand Line Company Srl strives to support customers with the right product and best-in-class expertise and knowledge. Our services and products must be met with employer/user rigour in selecting and utilising the PPE supplied.

usage.title: PPE Selection
usage.content: All provided information is based upon our current knowledge and understanding of the subject matter. This information is offered solely as suggestion for use in making your own decisions or product choices. We reserve the right to revise this information as new knowledge, experience, or regulatory guidance becomes available. The correct choice of PPE depends on the hazards present in the workplace. It is the responsibility of the employer and/or user to, among other things, carry out a proper risk assessment, select the appropriate PPE for the specific task, and ensure compatibility with other protective equipment where relevant.

heatResistance.title: PPE Use
heatResistance.content: All PPE must be used strictly in line with the manufacturer's instructions and safety guidelines. Improper use, modification, or use outside the intended scope may reduce the level of protection and increase the risk of injury. Employers and users are responsible for ensuring correct fit and training in proper use, maintaining and storing PPE as instructed, and replacing equipment when damaged, worn, or beyond its service life. PPE should be thoroughly inspected before any use to ensure they present no visible defect or damage. PPE use should never and cannot replace caution and care in handling hazardous materials and/or operating in hazardous environments.

cutResistance.title: Protection levels
cutResistance.content: While our personal protective equipment (PPE) is designed and certified in accordance with European regulations and standards, including Regulation (EU) 2016/425, no equipment can offer absolute or unlimited protection. Different types of PPE reduce specific hazards but do not eliminate the risk they are designed to mitigate. As non-exhaustive examples: cut, puncture, abrasion, tear, etc. resistance/protection reduce the risk of mechanical hazards but do not completely prevent or eliminate such risks, flame-resistant PPE lowers the risk of burns but does not prevent injury in all fire situations and are not 'fire-proof', cold-protective clothing mitigates frostbite but does not eliminate cold-related injury, chemical-resistant PPE reduce exposure risk but do not guarantee total protection against all substances, insulating gloves and mats reduce the risk of electrocution but cannot fully eliminate electrical hazards, radiation protective equipment mitigates certain radiation exposure risks but does not fully remove them. PPE should always be used as part of a comprehensive workplace safety system, which includes hazard control measures, training, supervision, and safe work procedures.

generalGuidelines.title: PPE Modification & Counterfeit Products
generalGuidelines.content: Any alteration, repair, or modification of PPE invalidates the product's certification and immediately voids any warranty. Modified equipment cannot be guaranteed to meet the original performance standards and must not be used. Only genuine products, purchased through authorized channels, are covered by certification and warranty. Counterfeit or imitation products may not provide the required level of protection and must not be used. Hand Line Company Srl disclaims all warranties and declines any liability other than where expressly provided or arising from misuse of the PPE.
